I hate to break it to you all, but here's what xpacerx said on reddit, "When the official Minecraft VR came out for Oculus the Oculus Touch controllers weren't developed so the official VR game never was designed for anything but a controller. Minecraft PSVR is a port of the Official Minecraft VR on PC. It took years to add dual support on the oculus so I doubt you'll see it in the PSVR version any time soon." There's also a YouTube video on the matter link here. So the gist of all my rambling to say I don't think Microsoft has any plans to make the move controllers compatible, because technically they didn't create that idea, it was a mod called Vivecraft. Over all if they add this yay, BUT I don't think anyone should count on it. Thanks for your time.

this already exists on all non-PC versions so it doesn't make since why it's not on PC as well. hopefully just an oversight. it's off-putting going into a sprint when i was trying to inch forward slightly and it makes playing the game irritating when switching from a game that has it disabled, which is about 90% of the games on the market nowadays
I agree, caving is really annoying with double tap to swim (because sprint = swim in water) please add this soon :(
We need this on java edition, double tap w makes it really hard to make precise movements.

The keyboard and mouse experience is near unplayable on Bedrock Edition. I'd like to make the switch over from Java to Bedrock, because it looks arguably better, has controller support if you want it, and performs enormously better than Java edition. But the double-tap to sprint feature will go off on its own, without even lifting my finger off of the W key. It happens mostly when I strafe left and right a lot, which I have to do, a lot. For people who use it, fantastic. More power to you. But I want the option to disable the feature. Control to sprint is (no pun intended) actually controllable. Double-tap to sprint is broken and unstable, and players need the option to disable it on PC.

Edit: It turns out that double-tapping any direction on WASD while moving forward will make you sprint. Feathering the strafe keys or backpedalling should never make you sprint. This is what made it appear as if it was sprinting on its own. Try it for yourself. Hold W and double-tap A or S or D and you will start sprinting. Does that make any sense? Give us the option already.

I agree. It gets really frustrating when you are swimming, or even crossing a small river.

The ability to disable this in the settings would be remarkably useful.

God yes, the double tap sprint/'fast swim' annoys me to no end. It's the one thing that bothers me most about the game, and is frankly the sole reason I don't play as often as I otherwise would. It's a minor grievance but it bothers me more and more every time I play the game and it comes up.

It's just far too easy to sprint by accident and my immersion is broken whenever it happens. All I want is a simple toggle in the options!

It would be especially useful to controller players (who can simply press in the thumbstick to sprint as in other games) and in situations where you need to move with precision (towards the edge of a sheer drop etc) and don't want to have to move far slower than necessary to avoid hitting W twice a bit too quickly and shooting off the edge. Also in situations where you want to move slowly at the surface of water and you would otherwise accidentally dive under the surface and shoot ahead.

It'd be wonderful if we could get an official response about this!!!
Hard to build under water (double tap make swim).

100% agree, this needs to be implemented! Especially since double-tapping any movement direction (while forward is held) can cause sprinting, I find I'm randomly sprinting even when not hitting the sprint key or double-tapping forward.

I went to Google for this exact issue, and found this thread. I agree 100% that this NEEDS to be an option in Java. I was dismayed to realize that this is already an option on consoles, but somehow isn't an option on Java?!?

I'm trying to build underwater, and making a lot of fine movements as I attempt to place blocks. This means coming close to double tapping my direction keys, and when this happens with the W key, I am suddenly shifted into the sprint/swim animation. It is INCREDIBLY annoying!!!

Please, please, please, Mojang, please give us this option!! Especially with all the beautiful features you added in 4.13, for building underwater, this has become a much needed option!!
Yes please! This is terrible on Bedrock/PE on Windows 10 when playing with keyboard+mouse, and there's no use for it since you can just hold Shift to sprint.

I need this option. No other PC game works like this, where double tapping your forward key makes you sprint. Instead of being able to move slowly forward by quickly tapping forward, you start running full speed ahead. I just fell to my death in a ravine because of it. Quickly tapping forward is a common action for some people who do a lot of PC gaming, and the double tap causes all sorts of unintended side effects.

This is a great idea. Many Chinese players quitted and turned to MCPE China edition because the China edition has this one tap sprint feature. I have been expecting this feature to be added for a long long long time, hopefully it will become a reality soon.

This is even more infuriating when youre playing cake wars on bedrock edition and you try to pillar across to somewhere as fast as you can but you end up sprinting right off the edge. I prefer playing cake wars on bedrock but i really prefer using mouse and keyboard so i have to be careful not to double tap W too fast near the edge :/

Yes indeed. It especially makes it difficult to perform precise movements underwater (ie when building or mining), as if you tap W one too many times too quickly, your body gets thrown from vertical to prone position (the swimming position). This has made my survival underwater build attempts excessively arduous, and considering how relatively easy it should be to code in, would be a great thing to include in the next update.

The double tap to sprint behavior is problematic with a controller where the value drifts a little bit when pressed fully forward. The game will interpret the instability in the stick reading as a double tab and turn sprinting on and off in weird ways causing a stuttering type of movement. Using the dedicated sprint key does not mitigate this issue. The only thing that will fix this is to disable the double tap forward to sprint behavior.

I honestly don't understand why this isn't in the game to begin with. It's really dumb because you can manually export worlds from iOS and Android by accessing
games\com.mojang\MinecraftWorlds\[random series of letters and numbers] and then zip up the contents of that folder and then change the extension to .mcworld. The Windows 10 version of Bedrock has this functionality and that's the same engine that the iOS and Android versions are running!

I usually export a world and then upload it to a cloud service, download it on another device and import it.

It's a 1-click provess on the Windows 10 version of Bedrock, but with phones I have to go into the world folder, make sure that the folder is the right world, zip the contents, change the file extension to .mcworld, then upload it.

 

This feature being added to the iOS, Android, and even the console version of Minecraft Bedrock could easily enable people to quickly share their own worlds! Please make this a feature in Minecraft Bedrock version 1.12!

It would be great to have import/export in Pocket Edition for the same reasons!

Also, I'm still playing on Windows 10 Mobile (many thanks for the Team for still updating this version!). However, I fear that someday eventually the updates will stop on Windows 10 Mobile and than I will be stuck on that old phone with my saves/worlds, without any ways to transfer them to other devices.

Thanks in advance!

We really need the option to export to a specified location so we can export it where we know where it is. Example SD card base directory
/sdcard/games/com.mojang/minecraftWorlds/ for anyone wondering. No root required nor has it ever been. Each folder within contains a world. Just check the thumbnails to know which is which.

you can compress the world folder to a .zip file, then change it to a .mcworld file when you open the .mcworld file it should open minecraft and import. You can do the same with resource pack folders.
the only problem is when you save your worlds internally (inside the application) instead of games/com.mojang/minecraftWorlds. This is what I stupidly did.

this is why i want mojang to put a share world button in the world menu so you can share worlds saved to application as .mcworlds. By the way to change where your worlds are saved go to settings>profile>file storage location. but doing this will mean all your old worlds will not show up. it is very hard to move worlds from application to external and if you find out how, please tell me. But the advantage of having them saved there is that if you delete minecraft gooogle still saves the application data like your worlds. if you wish to move worlds from external to application, just go to games/com.mojang/minecraftWorlds find the world folder and change it to an mcworld file (find out how to do that in my post above) then go back into minecraft change your file storage location from external to application then import the .mcworld.

by the way worlds saved in games/com.mojang/minecraftWorlds are ned with random characters, to identify the world you want, go into a folder then find levelname.text open it and if it says your world name then use that world folder otherwise try another folder. if you rename the forlders it doesn't matter!

yes it is possible I just disabled it. To disable it you need to navigate to C:\Users\"username"\AppData\Local\Packages\Microsoft.MinecraftUWP_8wekyb3d8bbwe\LocalState\games\com.mojang\minecraftpe

open options text document

scroll down to "gfx_vsync"

change from "1" to "0"

save changes 

launch game

Enjoy

Here's some feedback regarding trying to find the minecraft original music pack myself, and encountering significant difficulty:

Android 9, Minecraft version 1.14.60

Had the mobile version installed for about a week, and had not been able to figure out why the music volume was all the way up yet I never heard music.

Went googling,

first hits were from sites like Quora, giving an answer to why music wouldn't play, and thus I had to learn from a third party that the music I'm familiar with from Java version isn't included in the base game on mobile. I can in retrospect understand why it might not be, for size issues, but this information is not readily apparent or easy to discover, particularly given the implications of a music volume slider suggesting the presence of music.

Well okay, so I go to the store to try to find it,

searching "music" gave no results, "original" gave no results,

I joined the Minecraft discord to see if there was any info, found mostly people responding to my identical question with, "have you tried ~this reddit post~?", whereas the reddit post they would link contained no relevant information,

googled more,

FINALLY found someone suggesting to yet another person with my same question to filter by "creator: minecraft", and near the end of those results I finally, finally found the music pack.

Overall, this was unexpected, and needlessly arcane and difficult to execute.

Hi there, when referring to external tools, it would be best to describe what they are (and what specifically you like about them) so all the information is in one place (it's a kindness to our developers who may be skimming the site and often short on time).
